reviews.text: The sushi was excellent- super fresh and delicious with decent sized cuts on the sashimi. Service is impeccable and efficient, we were seated immediately and food came promptly. The quality of the food, together with the price and service are really impressive. Wish I could give this place more than 5 stars ‚ù§Ô∏è

A Solid Spot for a Quick Bite

Suram NYC in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen is a no-fuss sushi and ramen spot that delivers exactly what you expect. We stopped in for a quick dinner and kicked things off with a couple of sushi rolls‚Äîfresh, straightforward, and just right for an appetizer.

For mains, we each went with ramen built on their creamy twelve-hour chicken stock, topped with chicken chashu, egg, mushroom, naruto, scallion, and edamame. The broth was rich enough to satisfy but not something that lingers in your memory‚Äîcomforting, though not particularly standout.

The restaurant itself has a clean, minimalist look, with a vibe that leans toward Japanese-style dining but softened with an American twist. Service was polite, a little brisk, and seemed intent on keeping the evening moving along. Prices felt fair and very much in line with what you‚Äôd expect for this type of casual NYC spot.

All in all, Suram NYC is a decent choice when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood and craving sushi and ramen. It won‚Äôt blow you away, but it hits the mark for a reliable, uncomplicated meal.

#HellskitchenEats #NYCRamen #SushiAndRamen #QuickBitesNYC

The service was good. Dedy A. our server was so nice and friendly and attentive as well. She brought something to help my mum use her chopsticks HEHE... the food was great. The ramen was so good and the maki as well.

Had to call to make a reservation for 5 as the online system wouldn‚Äôt allow for groups over 4, but they booked us over the phone and got a link and reminders. All food and drinks were tasty and service extremely quick. My sons would definitely go again if we were in the area.

Wow!! Amazing food, not one complaint. Everything here was amazing - just right. They use high quality ingredients, and it shows. My favorite would be the salmon crispy rice with truffle! Find Chef Frankie. He has the best heart and talent. Again, no regrets and no disgusting feeling afterwards. Leaves you feeling full yet light! 10/10.

recentReviews.text: The best salmon crispy rice in town
The sushi deluxe was delicious, but the ramen was just okay. The servers were friendly, and the atmosphere was nice. I think the price is reasonable for Manhattan.
All four of us were really happy with everything. Suram has delicious food and excellent service - Gun, who waited our table, was very attentive and friendly so that we felt very welcome:)

The sushi was excellent- super fresh and delicious with decent sized cuts on the sashimi. Service is impeccable and efficient, we were seated immediately and food came promptly. The quality of the food, together with the price and service are really impressive. Wish I could give this place more than 5 stars ‚ù§Ô∏è

What an amazing inexpensive little place for a quick lunch. Food is superb, very fresh and tasty, the service is very quick. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly.

detailedReviews.text: The sushi deluxe was delicious, but the ramen was just okay. The servers were friendly, and the atmosphere was nice. I think the price is reasonable for Manhattan.

detailedReviews.author: Gordana Trajkoska
detailedReviews.text: What an amazing inexpensive little place for a quick lunch. Food is superb, very fresh and tasty, the service is very quick. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Joseph H. Villaluna
detailedReviews.text: Will be coming back.

detailedReviews.author: Sublime D
detailedReviews.text:
A very modern, lounge style Asian spot, Suram serves a Great Deal of very authentic Eastern Asian cuisine.
The service is quick, and they noticed me within a minute or two..
I ordered, and it out within 5-7 minutes. The Shoyu Ramen is quite a balanced taste, and the ingredients are there for a smooth, well made ramen. The Chicken stock is flavorful, and the bamboo shoots and scallion add great taste to a Great bowl of filling Ramen.

If you are a fan of Ramen, This is a great place, and I highly recommend this Store of food. 5/5.

8-24-25 Update:
Had their Unagi Don (Eel dish), the flavors were quite Honestly Perfect. 5-7 Minute Order To Arrive Service. Still 5 Stars.

detailedReviews.author: Linfei Li
detailedReviews.text: Loved the scallop roll! Food came out very quickly

detailedReviews.author: zpstiles 16
detailedReviews.text: Small portions, slow, over priced, dirty bathroom.

detailedReviews.author: Uraniaanna Somiras
detailedReviews.text: Delicious food and great service, thank you Gun!

detailedReviews.author: Mohammad Ali
detailedReviews.text: Food is awesome and great service from Gun.

detailedReviews.author: Justin
detailedReviews.text:
For a quick, late lunch, I stopped by Suram for some ramen. The establishment on a Friday at 2:30 pm was full (due to activities at the Javits Convention Center). Luckily, some tables cleared up and I received a seat for my party of 2 w/in 10 minutes.

I ordered the Kuro shio ramen ($19), made with chicken stock, chicken chashu, egg, mushroom, naruto (fish cake), scallion, edamame, and bamboo shoots. The portion size itself seemed on the delicate, lighter side. The chicken stock with the roasted shiitake mushroom tasted overbearingly mushroomy. The noodles seemed like the usual Sun Noodle brand or similar.

Audaciously, the establishment calls, what in any other setting would be rotisserie chicken breast slices, chicken "chashu".

detailedReviews.author: Herbert Castillo
detailedReviews.text: Pedimos 3 platos. Estaban riqu√≠simos los 3.

detailedReviews.author: Alejandro Sueldo
detailedReviews.text:
A Solid Spot for a Quick Bite

Suram NYC in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen is a no-fuss sushi and ramen spot that delivers exactly what you expect. We stopped in for a quick dinner and kicked things off with a couple of sushi rolls‚Äîfresh, straightforward, and just right for an appetizer.

For mains, we each went with ramen built on their creamy twelve-hour chicken stock, topped with chicken chashu, egg, mushroom, naruto, scallion, and edamame. The broth was rich enough to satisfy but not something that lingers in your memory‚Äîcomforting, though not particularly standout.

The restaurant itself has a clean, minimalist look, with a vibe that leans toward Japanese-style dining but softened with an American twist. Service was polite, a little brisk, and seemed intent on keeping the evening moving along. Prices felt fair and very much in line with what you‚Äôd expect for this type of casual NYC spot.

All in all, Suram NYC is a decent choice when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood and craving sushi and ramen. It won‚Äôt blow you away, but it hits the mark for a reliable, uncomplicated meal.

#HellskitchenEats #NYCRamen #SushiAndRamen #QuickBitesNYC

detailedReviews.author: Charmaine Morala
detailedReviews.text: The service was good. Dedy A. our server was so nice and friendly and attentive as well. She brought something to help my mum use her chopsticks HEHE... the food was great. The ramen was so good and the maki as well.

detailedReviews.author: Reine Mendoza
detailedReviews.text: Such a hidden gem! The quality of the fish is incredible and the tuna tastes close to toro. The salmon crispy rice with truffle was delicious. Gun is an incredible manager and so hospitable.

detailedReviews.author: Don Wunsch
detailedReviews.text: Very creative and tasty rolls. Reasonable prices for NYC. Competent and friendly service.

detailedReviews.author: Bernard Dunne
detailedReviews.text: Fab food and brilliant staff.

detailedReviews.author: J G
detailedReviews.text: I ordered takeout but I usually dine in. The food is always solid and the service is always good. I will say their cucumber salad is different every time. I wish they kept how the cut the cucumbers consistent but that‚Äôs just nitpicking.

detailedReviews.author: Emilis R
detailedReviews.text: Great ramen, cosy place, highly recommend

detailedReviews.author: Sam Anderson
detailedReviews.text: Had to call to make a reservation for 5 as the online system wouldn‚Äôt allow for groups over 4, but they booked us over the phone and got a link and reminders. All food and drinks were tasty and service extremely quick. My sons would definitely go again if we were in the area.

detailedReviews.author: Vishal Tailor
detailedReviews.text: Quality food with a great atmosphere. Staff was super friendly and I‚Äôll definitely have to come back!

detailedReviews.author: Alexandre Jeannerat
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food in a relaxing atmosphere üòä

detailedReviews.author: A S
detailedReviews.text: Enjoyed the crispy, crunchy rice very much

detailedReviews.author: Weizhen Ma
detailedReviews.text: Very delicious food and good atmosphere

detailedReviews.author: Stanley Ma
detailedReviews.text:
This is the best one during our trip in NYC.
After the High Line tour, we easily found this restaurant for the lunch.
Surprised to discover that the food is so good, even better with the the kindness and the smiles of the waitress.
Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Joe Hedman
detailedReviews.text: While visiting NYC for a conference, I decided to pop in and try Ramen for the first time. Of course we have all had the microwavable Ramen, however I have never had it authentic. I was pleasantly surprised. If I am ever back in NYC, I will stop there again.

detailedReviews.author: Jake Morrison
detailedReviews.text: Best ramen broth

detailedReviews.author: Y L
detailedReviews.text: Great sushi place in the Hudson Yards neighborhood. Enjoyed everything we tried.

detailedReviews.author: Arno Senoner (Arno)
detailedReviews.text: Just a supreme experience: fantastic food, excellent interior and exceptional friendliness. Outstanding.

detailedReviews.author: H Y
detailedReviews.text: Had to wait for 40 min for a single chirashi bowl. Way overpriced. The $30 bowl is mediocre, even not good as the $15 poke bowl at random Hawaiian poke stop.

detailedReviews.author: Chloe R
detailedReviews.text:
Crazy loud at its busiest but food comes out quick  and was so good!
Loved the shishito peppers and maki rolls

detailedReviews.author: Andres Ripoll
detailedReviews.text: The salmon truffle crispy rice is one of the most delicious things I've had, everything's fresh and the service is extremely attentive.

detailedReviews.author: Phil Andreoli
detailedReviews.text: Showed up at 9:30 as a group of 6. They took great care of us, made good recommendations for us. Food was excellent. Pictured is the white tuna sashimi.

detailedReviews.author: Annabelle Supit
detailedReviews.text: Wow!! Amazing food, not one complaint. Everything here was amazing - just right. They use high quality ingredients, and it shows. My favorite would be the salmon crispy rice with truffle! Find Chef Frankie. He has the best heart and talent. Again, no regrets and no disgusting feeling afterwards. Leaves you feeling full yet light! 10/10.

detailedReviews.author: Daniel
detailedReviews.text: Just wow! The ramen was delicious, the service was great and the place is beautiful.

detailedReviews.author: Elina Khaimova
detailedReviews.text: Fresh sushi, fresh ingredients, friendly staff!

detailedReviews.author: Shlok Joseph Paul
detailedReviews.text:
The tonkotsu broth hits its mark‚Äîcreamy, rich, with that long-simmered depth you‚Äôve come for. Noodles had a good bite, the chashu was tender and unshowy. They don‚Äôt chase flash or gimmicks. It‚Äôs the kind of bowl that is comforting in the madness of midtown.

Service was efficient without feeling robotic‚Äîa rare balance in Manhattan. Plenty of seats, open lines of sight, no cramped diners elbowing each other over a hot bowl. Just clean, considerate, midtown-buzzy room making you feel like you‚Äôre part of the show

detailedReviews.author: Dominique van Hoof
detailedReviews.text: Love this place!

detailedReviews.author: Komsit S.
detailedReviews.text: Best service!!! Great Chashu ramen

detailedReviews.author: christopher chalcraft
detailedReviews.text: really well done sushi. I am from Vancouver where sushi is very good and abundant so I have a pretty good gauge on what is good. my only con was the price... paid about 7 dollars a piece.

detailedReviews.author: Yaz
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food and the waiter, Gun, provided exceptional service. Highly recommend this place - beautiful vibe.

detailedReviews.author: Stella Antoine
detailedReviews.text: Superb dining experience, lovely ambience and incredibly attentive and friendly staff. What a gem!

detailedReviews.author: john gillette
detailedReviews.text: Excellent local sushi

detailedReviews.author: Zhipeng Xie
detailedReviews.text:
The overall score is given to the chef who is calling on the phone with the speaker why I was the only guest there at the end. I still give them 16% on the tips which I regret.
Be aware that you were given with white tuna which is prohibited in Japan

detailedReviews.author: Heba
detailedReviews.text:
We got the tempura spicy shrimp, eel, and avocado roll, and creamy chicken Ramen.
The shrimp was a bit rubbery, but the sauce was delicious. The sushi was delicious, but small roll. Rehman was nice and warm.

detailedReviews.author: Shafiq Shah
detailedReviews.text: Amazing sushi and ramen. My kids and I loved every single dish. The tempura rock shrimp was incredible. If you‚Äôre by the Hudson yards, I‚Äôd definitely check this place out!

detailedReviews.author: Richard Kraft
detailedReviews.text: Terrible service  had some alarm beeping the entire time.  Charged me for green tea which i never received.  Gave us the check before asking if we wanted anything else.  Sushi was good but could not make up for the service

detailedReviews.author: Arya Adesh
detailedReviews.text: The creamy miso ramen and the impossible tan tan ramen where my top 5 vegetarian ramen in NYC. The ramen was delicious. The staff especially Gun and Maria were excellent. The atmosphere here is welcoming and I would recommend this place to everyone who wants to try vegetarian Japanese cuisine.

detailedReviews.author: lynn cepeda
detailedReviews.text: Good food and great service from Gun!

detailedReviews.author: Sarah J
detailedReviews.text: Great food! Not many tables occupied when we went but don‚Äôt let that discourage you the food is tasty and reasonably priced! A great walk in.

detailedReviews.author: sofie labelle
detailedReviews.text: Such a lovely experience! Service was friendly, and the food was absolutely fantastic. Definitely a new favorite spot!

detailedReviews.author: Jason Derk
detailedReviews.text: Great meal. Ramen was delicious. Fresh. great service

detailedReviews.author: Day Squared
detailedReviews.text: The ramen was so yummy and flavorful!! I had the Shiromaru Classic, which has pork broth and pork belly! I will definitely be back to try other ones as well as the sushi! The waitstaff were so welcoming and accommodating. They made the experience even better!! Such a lovely place!

detailedReviews.author: Vincent Sugianto
detailedReviews.text: good food, friendly staff

detailedReviews.author: Kevin O'Shea
detailedReviews.text: Excellent ramen and sushi. Brought the family there and the staff and surroundings made everyone happy. Gun was our server and did a fantastic job! We'll definitely be back

detailedReviews.author: FA Hayek
detailedReviews.text: Great food, service and vibes.

detailedReviews.author: Erika Longo
detailedReviews.text: Super fast delivery! Fresh, yummy food! Recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Kate MacMillan
detailedReviews.text: Stumbled across Suram after walking the High Line. The sushi was very fresh and the Ramen robust.

detailedReviews.author: Francine W
detailedReviews.text: Such a great experience! The server was PHENOMENAL (sweet woman with the light short hair) and gave such phenomenal suggestions. We had Lychee Martinis and Ramen. We don‚Äôt eat pork so it was nice to get a tasty filling ramen broth! Our server was the epitome of class, and hospitality. Don‚Äôt question it, just go!

detailedReviews.author: Egor
detailedReviews.text: The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Prices were very affordable, especially considering the quality. The place itself is cozy with a charming interior, perfect for a relaxed meal. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Ginger Chae
detailedReviews.text: Delicious and great ambiance. Feels luxury without the price tag

detailedReviews.author: Wow Newma
detailedReviews.text: Very good food and nice ambient restaurant, Fresh fish and nice broth

detailedReviews.author: Amelia A
detailedReviews.text: They have a nice service and delicious food!! All the fish were fresh and tasty, i also recommend the tonkotsu ramen. Their staffs are very professional and helpful. Definitely recommend the place!!

detailedReviews.author: John S
detailedReviews.text:
Oh, Suram-Hudson Yards! You were amazing! The food quality, the atmosphere and the service were outstanding! While there are many, many sushi and ramen places in New York serving these beloved Japanese dishes; there is just something about this place.  I could genuinely eat here daily.
The atmosphere is modern and modest, reflective of both simplicity and quality. The staff were engaging, polite and very attentive to everyone‚Äôs needs. And the food, wow! High quality ingredients, plated beautifully.
Over the course of two separate nights of dining, I‚Äôd say we went through about 1/2 of the menu between the three of us. If you ever find yourself in midtown Manhattan on the west side, treat yourself to this incredible dining experience. You won‚Äôt regret it! Tanoshimu!

detailedReviews.author: Tali Graham
detailedReviews.text: Delicious and friendly!

detailedReviews.author: Connie G
detailedReviews.text: Nice selection of wine and very friendly and knowledgeable staff.

detailedReviews.author: Daniel W
detailedReviews.text: The Omakase Sushi was so bad which is nit worth the price.

detailedReviews.author: Aline Oliveira
detailedReviews.text: By far the best Japanese restaurant I ever went to! Excellent food and service, extremely fresh food and clean place. You can taste the quality of the ingredients! Im amazed!

detailedReviews.author: Gregor J. Rothfuss
detailedReviews.text:
The first place to offer impossible ground meat for their tantanmen. Broth was great.
Wasn't a fan of the noodles though.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.7/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the attentive and friendly service, particularly highlighting staff members like Gun and Dedy A. for making them feel welcome and valued. - review management can highlight this positive aspect

The food is frequently described as delicious, fresh, and well-prepared, with standout dishes like the salmon crispy rice, sushi, and ramen receiving high marks for taste and quality. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant's quick and efficient service, with food arriving promptly, is appreciated by customers who value a seamless dining experience. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and slow service - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews regarding service and food quality - review management can address this concern
Small portions and perceived overpricing - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Peter Shearer
positive.text: The best salmon crispy rice in town

positive.author: Sophie Lee
positive.text: The sushi deluxe was delicious, but the ramen was just okay. The servers were friendly, and the atmosphere was nice. I think the price is reasonable for Manhattan.

neutral.author: Justin
neutral.text:
For a quick, late lunch, I stopped by Suram for some ramen. The establishment on a Friday at 2:30 pm was full (due to activities at the Javits Convention Center). Luckily, some tables cleared up and I received a seat for my party of 2 w/in 10 minutes.

I ordered the Kuro shio ramen ($19), made with chicken stock, chicken chashu, egg, mushroom, naruto (fish cake), scallion, edamame, and bamboo shoots. The portion size itself seemed on the delicate, lighter side. The chicken stock with the roasted shiitake mushroom tasted overbearingly mushroomy. The noodles seemed like the usual Sun Noodle brand or similar.

Audaciously, the establishment calls, what in any other setting would be rotisserie chicken breast slices, chicken "chashu".

neutral.author: Heba
neutral.text:
We got the tempura spicy shrimp, eel, and avocado roll, and creamy chicken Ramen.
The shrimp was a bit rubbery, but the sauce was delicious. The sushi was delicious, but small roll. Rehman was nice and warm.

negative.author: zpstiles 16
negative.text: Small portions, slow, over priced, dirty bathroom.

negative.author: H Y
negative.text: Had to wait for 40 min for a single chirashi bowl. Way overpriced. The $30 bowl is mediocre, even not good as the $15 poke bowl at random Hawaiian poke stop.

negative.author: Zhipeng Xie
negative.text:
The overall score is given to the chef who is calling on the phone with the speaker why I was the only guest there at the end. I still give them 16% on the tips which I regret.
Be aware that you were given with white tuna which is prohibited in Japan
